channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Saudi Arabia has imported sensitive missile technology from the Chinese military and is manufacturing its own ballistic missiles, according to Saudi advisers and officials familiar with U.S. intelligence, raising new worries of a Middle East arms race https://t.co/LO1ipeUSck

From @WSJopinion: If the GOP can’t learn to shake the Trump obsession with alleged election fraud, the former president could hand Democrats the White House—again, writes @KarlRove https://t.co/G64Z3JOyUH
The U.S. cleared the use of Merck’s Covid-19 pill molnupiravir, the latest easy-to-use therapy that infected people can take to keep out of the hospital https://t.co/DUiAahMt3V
TikTok became the world’s most visited site in 2021, even surpassing Google, new research shows #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/cxwvgPAtHz

Almost two years into the pandemic that left millions doing their jobs from home, American workers say they are burned out, and employers are struggling to respond #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/TIqSOoyjzC
A college a capella choir director first came up with the lyrics for “Merry Christmas Darling.” Then the Carpenters turned it into a seasonal hit. https://t.co/XvfsNzxxUb
Breaking: Kimberly Potter, the former police officer who shot and killed Daunte Wright in a traffic stop, was found guilty of first and second degree manslaughter https://t.co/tPThSEK7s8
The Chinese city of Xi’an on Wednesday ordered its 13 million residents to stay at home and avoid unnecessary outings in one of the biggest lockdowns in the country this year https://t.co/a4pGMpnH5c
U.S. Rep. Mary Gay Scanlon was carjacked at gunpoint in Philadelphia Wednesday as she walked to her car from a meeting, her office said

People infected with Omicron are between 50% to 70% less likely to be hospitalized than those with Delta, according to a U.K, study that adds to a growing body of evidence on the variant’s reduced severity in populations with high levels of immunity https://t.co/dwBDT5xK15
Joan Didion, the literary journalist and novelist whose writings included chronicles of life in Los Angeles and "The Year of Magical Thinking," has died at 87 https://t.co/nmZdnT7fu2
Can you pass a Covid test? Congratulations! You’re on the Orlando Magic. https://t.co/9YPXsIMbk9
Elon Musk unloaded more Tesla stock on Wednesday, bringing the total value of his share sales to over $15 billion since he embarked on a selling spree last month #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/tALbGcitdZ
In the first 10 months of this year, American workers handed in nearly 39 million resignations. Bosses say rampant workplace burnout is a big problem. https://t.co/jUhkm9JWse

The resurgence of Covid-19 in Europe means another Christmas in isolation for many elderly Italians. "For people that age, seeing their loved ones is in most cases the only reason to live," said one psychologist. https://t.co/sz9pWy9Rp7

From @WSJopinion: Forcing immune, young, healthy, low-risk students to get a third vaccine shot is excessive and wasteful, writes @MartyMakary. Precious vaccine doses should be going to poor countries that still don’t have enough. https://t.co/yqZK9HgVPM
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/kQkuhLXIdk https://t.co/wvumghY6fF

From @WSJopinion: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is already the shadow Majority Leader, so she might as well try and make it official. If the Senate is so awful, run to win and clean it up. https://t.co/eac4pYrMVl

Pope Francis appointed Sister Nathalie Becquart as the first woman to serve as an undersecretary of the Synod of Bishops earlier this year. “I felt as if I was at the beginning of a new adventure, called to go into the deep sea,” she said. https://t.co/seVUIRunTg
Elon Musk says his primary home is a “kinda awesome” $50,000 house that he rents in South Texas near the Mexican border. He also has been living in a mansion in Austin. https://t.co/ZCv9iQ97JE

The “Pillar of Shame,” a monument commemorating the victims of the Tiananmen Square massacre, stood at the University of Hong Kong for more than two decades until it was removed Thursday https://t.co/kACqTNFUSe
At least $100 billion has been stolen from Covid-19 relief programs designed to help individuals and businesses harmed by the pandemic, the U.S. Secret Service said https://t.co/DTiEwFCMKk
The risk of hospitalization from Omicron is substantially lower than from Delta, new studies in Scotland and South Africa suggest https://t.co/A0Zm2dKiDa
Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey has triggered a debate among tech stalwarts over how decentralized the future internet may be https://t.co/Trd6BMjt2h
Meet the ham sniffers of Spain. (Yes, their job is to sniff hams.) And this is their busy season. https://t.co/UMrIiueKXR

New evidence has emerged that the Omicron variant may cause significantly less serious disease than earlier strains of Covid-19, as infections hit records in some parts of the U.S. https://t.co/fBX28L82f8

President Biden said he's eager to run for reelection against Donald Trump in 2024, and expressed regret that he didn’t act more quickly to distribute Covid-19 tests to the public https://t.co/wfJDMPxubK

Amazon said all workers at its hundreds of U.S. warehouses will have to wear masks again starting Wednesday, a mandate prompted by the rapid spread of the coronavirus’s Omicron variant https://t.co/8gJhlwu0Mu
Pop star Camila Cabello sold her Hollywood Hills home for $4.3 million after only nine days on the market https://t.co/66L91uN5uX
TikTok was the world’s most visited site on the internet in 2021, surpassing last year’s leader, Google https://t.co/p8r8GtqtpD
Pandemic stress, the erosion of boundaries between personal and professional spheres, and an exhausted slide toward casualness are making many of us swear more https://t.co/A4e1PlBeMg
At least $100 billion has been stolen from Covid-19 relief programs designed to help individuals and businesses harmed by the pandemic, the U.S. Secret Service said https://t.co/D6lbb2gpcz

The Omicron variant’s spread across the U.S. threatens to drive up cases, as many people head indoors during the cold weather. The season, it turns out, appears to play an important role in where Covid-19 strikes most. https://t.co/Cv861Um2Ra
President Biden extended the pause on student-loan payments to May 1. It had been scheduled to expire at the end of January. https://t.co/qRtuCyyjJf
Elon Musk says his primary home is a “kinda awesome” $50,000 house that he rents in South Texas near the Mexican border. He also has been living in a mansion in Austin. https://t.co/KpEbxMYZJ7
Breaking: The U.S. cleared use of a Covid-19 pill from Pfizer, the first drug that newly infected patients can now take at home to stay out of the hospital https://t.co/xsOgICOFyL
The risk of hospitalization from Omicron is substantially lower than from Delta, new studies in Scotland and South Africa suggest https://t.co/sK44728fNN
The Biden administration is considering another extension to the moratorium on student-loan payments put in place at the start of the pandemic https://t.co/kbTY0G1Hoy
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/qq4ZCyBiaa https://t.co/oAPTDzn4iK
On Friday, NASA will launch the largest and most powerful space telescope ever built https://t.co/esXgg3HHJq

A London court awarded the ex-wife of Dubai's ruler a divorce settlement of more than $728 million, in a rare case that pulled back the curtain on one of the world’s richest families https://t.co/eFunoArRWA
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/nlPrIIAO5v
An unprecedented peek inside a dinosaur egg revealed a perfectly preserved oviraptor—and a surprise about the way the animals hatched https://t.co/sZ3MSz2XoF
A jury on Tuesday found Harvard professor Charles Lieber guilty on six counts related to payments he received from a Chinese government talent program https://t.co/vlEmHjm6FQ
One hundred times as powerful as Hubble, the James Webb telescope could show the face of Abraham Lincoln on a penny from 24 miles away https://t.co/jft9LjMyqy
The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol says it wants to question GOP Rep. Scott Perry about efforts to replace an acting attorney general https://t.co/XHuPYYmxPx
Tennis star Rafael Nadal said he tested positive for Covid-19 after arriving in Spain from a tournament in Abu Dhabi https://t.co/Nw8tidSI48
An unprecedented peek inside a dinosaur egg revealed a perfectly preserved oviraptor—and a surprise about the way the animals hatched https://t.co/o0MxdBbEYw

From @WSJopinion: The party that constantly seeks control over our lives is now governing—or failing to govern—a nation that is spinning wildly out of control, writes @gerardtbaker https://t.co/XdHRYD5RcV
The U.S. plans to distribute 500 million free at-home Covid tests and send federal medical workers to overburdened hospitals, officials said https://t.co/eFPRHZGuMO
